content: In the following questions, I will provide you with a graph (given as an array of nodes and an array of edges), a starting point, and a target point. Please return the shortest path from the starting point to the target point in the following format: 1->2->3->4... Please note that your answer should only include the result in this format and should not contain any other words.(Notice that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.)

The shortest path from node 6 to node 1 in the given graph is:

1->2->3

To arrive at node 1 from node 6, you must first go to node 2 (via edge 0->2), then to node 3 (via edge 2->3), and finally to node 1 (via edge 3->1). Therefore, the shortest path is 1->2->3. Note that this is the shortest path that starts from node 6 and ends at node 1, and that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.

The shortest path from node 6 to node 2 in the given graph is:

1->3->2

To arrive at node 2 from node 6, you must first go to node 3 (via edge 0->3), then to node 2 (via edge 3->2). Therefore, the shortest path is 1->3->2. Note that this is the shortest path that starts from node 6 and ends at node 2, and that for the same graph, if the endpoint is changed to the previous point, the new shortest path should be the original shortest path minus the last point.
